column8: ·奥尔拉的「基础打击」与「基础防御」也视为一种诗篇。诗篇跃迁时会切换到不同的情绪，情绪能直接影响此诗篇的效果。处于不同的情绪会带来不同的队伍持续效果。\n·奥尔拉每有 1% 死亡抵抗，就使该效果加成提高初始值的 0.1%。
column9: Horla's "Strike" and "Defend" Command Cards are treated as Psalms.\nWhen Horla's Command Cards trigger their Leap Effect, she enters the emotion state associated with that Psalm. Horla can only have one emotion state active at a time, and triggering a different Psalm's Leap Effect will change the emotion state to the corresponding emotion. Each emotion has a team-wide passive buff that is active while Horla remains in that emotion. Each emotion state enhances a different effect of Horla's Exalt. The emotion state persists throughout the exploration.\nFor every 1% Death Resistance Horla has, the passive effect value of Horla's current emotion state increases by 0.1%.
"Anger"

column9: The Final DMG dealt by all Awakeners is increased by [StateArg1]%. Increase the temporary Crit. Rate and Crit. DMG gained by Resplendent Chapters.

column9: All Awakeners' Shield gain and HP Recovery effects, as well as the <PowerIconKeywords:STR> reduction effect they apply, are increased by [StateArg1]%. Increase the HP Recovery of Resplendent Chapters.
"Happiness"

column9: The Aliemus gained by all Awakeners is increased by [DescArg1]%. All Command Cards gain Retain. Unused Arithmetica is retained. Resplendent Chapters grants more Aliemus.

column8:
拥有隐喻<D06CardKeyWordnu:「怒」> [DescArg2] 层：「狂想诗篇」触发跃迁时将额外造成伤害。
拥有隐喻<D06CardKeyWordai:「哀」> [DescArg3] 层：「哀恸诗篇」触发跃迁时将额外回复生命。
拥有隐喻<D06CardKeyWordxi:「喜」> [DescArg1] 层：「幻梦诗篇」触发跃迁时将额外使唤醒体获得狂气。
拥有隐喻<D06CardKeyWordju:「惧」> [DescArg4] 层：「诡谲诗篇」触发跃迁时将额外获得力量。
column9:
Possessing the metaphor <D06CardKeyWordnu:"Anger"> [DescArg2] layer: "Snarl Psalm" triggers Leap and deals additional Damage.
Possessing the metaphor <D06CardKeyWordai:"Sorrow"> [DescArg3] layer: "Elegy Psalm" triggers Leap and restores additional Life.
Possessing the metaphor <D06CardKeyWordxi:"Happiness"> [DescArg1] layer: "Carol Psalm" triggers Leap and gives additional Aliemus to the selected Awakener.
Possessing the metaphor <D06CardKeyWordju:"Fear"> [DescArg4] layer: "Dirge Psalm" triggers Leap and gives additional STR.

column8: 还在担任陪读女眷时，奥尔拉便喜欢躲在书斋的一角阅读诗集。那些哀恸的诗句，总能让她动容。
column9: When she still served as a tutor, Horla loved hiding in the study corner to read poems. Those mournful verses always moved her.

column8:
庭院悬铃木沙沙摇晃，鸟雀啼鸣出春日的颂歌，玫瑰绽放时的芬芳自窄小的天窗栅栏沁入她的鼻腔。
孤独的花房之中，繁花入眼，皆是诗篇。
column9:
The plane trees in the courtyard rustled, birds cried spring hymns, and the fragrance of blooming roses drifted through the narrow bars of the skylight into her nose.
In the solitary flower house, every blooming flower was a psalm.

column8: 诗册序言
column9: Prelude Verse

column8: 奥尔拉获得 <Energy:[Energy:Arg1]> 点狂气。<ExaltIconKeywords:灵知觉醒>：立刻获得 1 层当前情绪外其他情绪的<D06CardKeyWord1:隐喻>，每回合开始也会获得 1 层，每种<D06CardKeyWord1:隐喻>最多 3 层，每层<D06CardKeyWord1:隐喻>使诗篇<TransitionIconKeywords:跃迁>时消耗对应<D06CardKeyWord1:隐喻>并获得额外加成。
column9: Horla obtains <Energy:[Energy:Arg1]> Aliemus.<ExaltIconKeywords:Rouse>: Immediately gain 1 stack of <D06CardKeyWord1:Metaphor> for each emotion Horla is not currently in. At the start of each turn, repeat this effect. Each emotion can have a maximum of 3 stacks of <D06CardKeyWord1:Metaphor>. When Psalm cards trigger <TransitionIconKeywords:Leap>, consume all <D06CardKeyWord1:Metaphor> stacks of that emotion to trigger the corresponding effects.

column8:
她是心绪的载体，是情愫的延续。
就放纵这浓墨流淌吧，就放纵这诗才挥霍吧。
这世间未曾诉诸于口的话语，将从她的诗册开始。
column9:
She is the vessel of emotions, the continuation of sentiments.
Let this dark ink flow freely, let this poetic talent be wasted.
The unspoken words of this world will begin from her poetry book.

column8: 幻梦诗篇
column9: Carol Psalm

column8:
诗歌首次出版的那天，花匠满怀雀跃地带来了一朵玫瑰。
她小心翼翼地将玫瑰珍藏起来。在花园走向衰亡之前，那是这场幻梦最美好的高潮。
column9:
On the day the poem was first published, the gardener joyfully brought a rose.
She carefully preserved the rose. Before the garden's decline, it was the most beautiful climax of this dream.

column8:
她以新的姓名重生于世间，遮掩容貌，不复轮廓。
流传于世间的，只有以她的口吻述说的诗篇。
如此便已足够。
诗人不必拥有形貌……他们本应隐形于浓墨之中，书页之后。
column9:
She is reborn into the world with a new name, concealing her appearance, her features gone.
What remains in the world are poems spoken in her voice.
This is enough.
A poet does not need a form... They should become invisible within dark ink and behind pages.
